content: A Retrospective of House Rules Changes Since the 110th Congress highlights the majority party's role in organizing the House, electing the Speaker, and making rules changes at the start of each new Congress. While the House largely maintains previous rules, changes are also adopted to reflect the majority's prerogatives. This process differs from the Senate's approach to rules. The House adopts rules changes at the start of each Congress, unlike the Senate.
